info.name: Detect Deprecated XSS Protection Header
author: joshlarsen
info.description: Setting the XSS-Protection header is deprecated by most browsers. Setting the header to anything other than `0` can actually introduce an XSS vulnerability.

request:
GET /histovec HTTP/1.1
Host: histovec.interieur.gouv.fr
User-Agent: Nuclei - Open-source project (github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei)
Connection: close
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en
Accept-Encoding: gzip
response:
HTTP/1.1 301 Moved Permanently Connection: close Content-Length: 162 Cache-Control: max-age=86400 Content-Security-Policy: default-src https: 'self' 'unsafe-inline' 'unsafe-eval'; Content-Type: text/html Date: Thu, 26 May 2022 18:29:46 GMT Expires: Fri, 27 May 2022 18:29:46 GMT Feature-Policy: geolocation none;midi none;notifications none;push none;sync-xhr none;microphone none;camera none;magnetometer none;gyroscope self;speaker self;vibrate none;fullscreen self;payment none; Location: https://histovec.interieur.gouv.fr/histovec/ Referrer-Policy: same-origin X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN X-Xss-Protection: 1; mode=block 301 Moved Permanently

301 Moved Permanently

nginx
